reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very basic hotel,rooms clean but furnature old & inadequate for todays traveller. Very noisy at night because of its position in the city & all the drug taking ect. Breakfast very good & management helpfull. Hotel rooms need major refurbishment.
reviews.title: Avoid at all costs.
RHO great place to stay
reviews.text: Do not use Connexxion airport shuttle, they are not to be relied on.Use the train to and from airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel is great location and well priced. Very clean and room not bad size.Staff were very pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: brill overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my hotel booking had been accidently cancelled by travel agent, but the RHO staff were very helpfull in sorting everything out for me, and i got an excellent room, spacious and clean. The location of the Hotel is superb and i will certainly return. Thanks Manuelito for all your help.
reviews.title: Loved the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location,just off of Dam Square,hotel was very clean,staff were friendly,dont think the chef could cope with the breakfast "rush" as nothing seemed 2 b topped up quick enough,but that said the food was pleasent enough!
reviews.title: Good central hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Rho hotel is in a fantastic position - just off Dam Square down a side street. The main foyer is very ornate and looks a bit like an old Victorian Train Station. Our main gripe was the room.
reviews.title: Great Location - shme about the rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was very small with little space to put your suitcase out. The rooms look like they have been split into smaller sizes and of course this makes the corridors etc very difficult to navigate as they wander around all over the place. We were on the first floor and at first got the lift up to our room. We decided to walk up the stairs the next day and couldn't find our room and so had to backtrack to the lobby. Again, because the rooms have been split the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything above, below and beside you. At the end of the day, this was not a luxury hotel - but we weren't expecting one! It was clean and basic and even with the funny room we enjoyed our holiday and would recommend it as a hotel.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really wonderful clean hotel. Fantastic position near to just about everthing. Staff were really good and friendly. Our room was absolutely spotless. So quiet at nights. The breakfast was really good and filling.
reviews.title: Eh... Not Great, not terrible
Can't believe some of the reviews here
reviews.text: We booked on the basis of a review in our guidebook (Rough Guide). Having booked a non-smoking room for 3 nights, we arrived to be told that only smoking rooms were available, but that we could move to a non-smoking room for the second and third night. We agreed, since the alternative was to schlep around looking for another hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: The smoking room was vile - almost unbearable. The non-smoking room was fine, clean but threadbare, with a gigantic bathroom. The rooms had very basic furnishings, carpets etc., and felt very flimsy. Each of the two rooms were very different in size and shape. Both rooms were at the back of the hotel and the non-smoking room was on an upper floor. Both were pretty quiet, in terms of both hotel noise and street noise.
reviews.title: Glad I stayed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed in the rho hotel in amsterdam for three nights at the end of september!! location...fantastic...it was so easy to find as it was right beside dam square and a 5-10min walk from the cenral station!!! the staff were very friendly and helpful (even when i managed to lock the safe, not able to open it!!!) check-in was quick, 24hr reception was fantastic...you could leave your key in at anytime!! the bedroom was clean & comfortable, but im glad there was a fan in the room....it got very warm quickly!! the ensuite was nice and big!!! the bedroom had its own safe that you made up ur own code for...which was very good!! the continental breakfast was fantastic...kept us goin to well into the middle of the day!!! only had one problem, as a non-smoker and used to the smoking ban in N.Ireland, i disliked people smoking in the lobby...especially in the morning when heading down for breakfast.
reviews.title: The Rho....very comfortable and friendly hotel
Value for money...
reviews.text: A group of us went to amsterdam for my b.friends 30th birthday so we just wanted a clean hassle free place to stay, I would recommend this hotel if you want somewhere comfortable and in the middle of everything... the staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was good. We requested rooms to the back of the hotel as Dam square can be noisy. Some of the rooms are a little narrow but we just wanted somewhere to sleep! Would stay there again...

reviews.title: A good stay
reviews.text: A really nice place with a great location just of Dam Square, the Hotel was clean but slightly dark with not the best views but you get what you pay for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: You can tell some of the rooms have had weed smoked in them which is a slight turn off but ho hum!
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.disliked: — rooms can be a little dark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The breakfast was really nice and worth it!
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent Nov. 2 thru 8 at the RHO Hotel and would absolutely book there again on our next trip to Amsterdam. The staff is very helpful - especially with directions and also with frank appraisal of some of the local eating establishments. They never once gave us bad information. Our room is typical of Europe - small! But, we expected that. The room was cleaner than many American hotels we have stayed in! (the location is terrific - easy walk to shopping and museums) Here are some key points:
reviews.title: Great place to stay - centrally located!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. take care with the hot water - take time to adjust the temperature (very common problem in European hotels), but not a big problem is you are aware of it.
reviews.title: Good location, very average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. the bathroom was adequate in size and appointment. Soap and shampoo are furnished.
reviews.title: Long Weekend

likes.disliked: — No view as it was at the back of the hotel with a velux window

reviews.title: Great location, clean and friendly
reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights and found it to be an excellent location for walking around the sights of Amsterdam. Easy to get to from Central Station, about a five minute walk. Arrived late at night but felt quite safe walking with suitcase from station. Hotel just metres from Dam Square. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and tidy, everything available except kettle to make a hot drink. Although close to Dam Square, no noise could be heard in room. Breakfasts were very good and plenty of choice. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Would certainly stay there again if visiting Amsterdam again.

reviews.title: nice breakfast thats about it!
reviews.text: got a great size room,and were delighted,but that soon passed when we tried to go asleep that night..we were put next to the staff room of hotel and constant banging of door kept us awake all night.(room 105) clean towels only giving once on 3 day visit,we had no clean towels left on last nite.bring a hairdryer,they say they have one in room but its not worth using.i would pay the extra money in future to stay in a higher star hotel,it is a holiday after all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wife and i just returned from 4 nights in the RHO celebrating New Year. This is the second time we have stayed here and i must say the reviews on here are pretty accurate.
reviews.title: Basic good value

likes.liked: — Great staff and simply the best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location merits 5 stars, as do the staff, who are genuinely friendly and helpful if you approach them with the right attitude.
reviews.title: Think it was brill!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: General cleanliness is 4 star as is the breakfast.
reviews.title: Pretty basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was easy to find, right off of Dam Square (good location). Something I found strange was that they made me pay for the full stay on check in (?) The hotel was such a disapointment; dark hallways, dark rooms, no AC just a fan, musty smell, unlike one of the pics I saw our bathroom didn't have a shower basin just a curtin and the water would splash all over the floor, the safe worked but we found a used bottle of lubricant in it :( ewwwww, there was a note on the window that said not to open it for safety purposes so we didn't then one night we came back and found it wide open!!! there were many drug dealers in the area which i found scary. On a lighter note the bed was comfortable, and the breakfast was ok.
reviews.title: Don't recomend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do not recomend this hotel.
reviews.title: Delightful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: Just returned from an 8-nite stay. The rooms were somewhat small, and the "decor" minimal, but they were clean and comfortable. GREAT mattresses. We stayed first in a front room and it was noisy at night due to street noise from The Dam. Went out at midnite to see what all the ruckus was, but it was just people sitting out in cafes talking, and a band at one cafe. Felt very safe. We moved to a room at the back and it was very quiet. Breakfast was wonderful, with a choice of English/American or Dutch. Everything you could want. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

likes.disliked: — Some spillover from the Red Light District in the immediate vicinity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from Amsterdam and stayed at the Rho. The location was excellent and had an easy time getting around. The room was immaculate. We stayed at the recommendation of a friend who is stationed in Germany and have only one complaint about the hotel - if you want a shower where the temperature stays constant this is not the place for you. Otherwise, the staff was great and when asked offered all kinds of great ideas of where to go and made reservations for us. When we left they called a cab, I asked how much it would cost, then when the cabbie came I made sure to doublecheck after being ripped off several times in Nice (It cost me 40 euro).The breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs, bacon, rice, yogurt, cold ham, and lots of juices and coffee. There were some rough looking characters hanging out at the corner but that had more to do with the bank machine than the hotel but we also noticed a lot of police presence especially in the evenings.
reviews.title: Look around for a better hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is okay but a lot of local tugs hang around at the side of this hotel.They make a lot of racket at night and sleeping at this hotel is not easy.
reviews.title: Good and bad
B+ / A-
reviews.text: Overall, we liked the Rho Hotel and would probably stay there again. The location was unbeatable, fotsteps away from Dam Square. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. They were great. The breakfast was very good as well. We stayed in 2 different non-smoking rooms there because we left on a trip out of the city and then came back. The first room was a double and was quite small. Of the two slanted windows, one had a missing blinds and the other a broken blind. The mattress had pretty much no support. The second room, however, had 2 twin beds and was much larger and nicer. The hotel was quiet, but we were told that the smoking rooms were not as quiet. Also, I'm not sure if you'd need to open the windows in the summer because I'm not sure if they have a.c. I'm not sure what the noise level would be like with open windows. Of course, I've stayed in much nicer hotels, but for the price and location, this one is pretty good.

reviews.title: Great people, wonderful hotel!
reviews.text: after arriving in amsterdam to see that the hotel i made reservations at was non-existant, a kind man showed me and my 2 friends to the Rho Hotel and said he liked it. WOW! its a very interesting looking hotel, the GM is a great guy who cut us a great deal on a 4 person flat for 9 days. If it weren't for that hotel, AND THEIR AWESOME BREAKFAST, our trip wouldn't have been nearly as sweet ;) I now call the Rho Hotel my "home away from home"!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Having read previous reviews before travelling I completely disagree about the staff. They were all friendly, helpful, and had a good sense of humour! The breakfasts were good, and it was all very easy. The location is convenient. The hotel was warm; it was freezing outside. Big rooms with all you would expect in a city centre hotel in this category. I would be happy to go there again.
reviews.title: Helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: I spent 5 days in Amsterdam with my mum in February 2006, staying at the Rho, and I must strongly disagree with the previous negative reviews of this hotel, as we found it very pleasing.
reviews.title: A pleasure.
Excellent Location and Service.
reviews.text: The hotel staff were polite, professional, efficient and friendly. No, they didn't chat with people too much, but do you really want that?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is clearly not a 3 star hotel ! The staff is rather unpleasant, decoration is inexistant, rooms are tiny and beds are too soft, no air conditioning in the rooms which are just under the rooftop, and to finish breakfast is mediocre (no croissants or pancakes only bread, no choice in fruit juices etc...). The only good point is its location right on the Dam place.
reviews.title: Bad hotel, good location
Good price, good location, helpful staff
reviews.text: Ideally located, just of the Dam Square. Some other reviewers have been critical of the accommodation and staff. True, it is not exactly plush, but the rooms were clean, the public areas pleasant, and it was excellent value for money. Staff v helpful and friendly.

reviews.title: not too bad
reviews.text: I arrived in Amsterdam and discovered there was no way I was going to stay 4 nights in the hotel I had booked from home. So, on my way to find a new hotel for the same day, the RHO was one of the few hotels that could take me. If you want a hotel room that is clean, equipped with a bathroom, tv, phone, and safe - the Rho is fine. Nothing special, but it does the job. My main complaints are these: the walls are thin, so you hear any noise. If you're there in the summer, there seems to be no air conditioning, and the room can get really hot. They have a storage room to hold your luggage the day you leave, but this is totally unsafe as anyone can go in and take any luggage. And, finally, be careful about how they charge you. I was over-charged for one night by a particular staff member who knew I had nowhere to stay (despite the other reviews, I didn't find all the staff that hospitable; some were, some were not). When I went to pay the next morning, I luckily was saved by another staff member who couldn't undersatnd why i was over-charged 50 euros. Overall, considering other hotels I came across in Amsterdam, I would give the Rho another try, aware of the problems above. Oh, and just down Nes, a few steps from the hotel really, there is a great pub/cafe. Awesome food, staff, ambience. Give them a try.

reviews.title: Hotel Rho...........perfect for us three
reviews.text: Hello to all review readers.

reviews.title: so disappointed
reviews.text: Me and my 2 friends went to amsterdam and stayed on the 30th of june till the 2nd of july 2006 for the id&t sensation white event at the amsterdam arena, and our choice of hotel was the hotel rho.

reviews.title: Well worth a look
reviews.text: We were please with our stay, very friendly staff who were only to happy to help, good sized room and great breakfast. But as with all hotels there were a few faults. Beds were very soft, we were on the 4th floor so it was very hot, could of done with air conditioning. We had to leave the window open all night and, as we looked out onto a street, we could hear loud music and people leaving bars at all hours of the night. There also seemed to be a shortage of large towels which lead to us asking at reception repeatedly.

reviews.title: Clean,but wouldn't go back
reviews.text: For the amount of time we actually spent in the room though it was fine for us and we would stay again.

reviews.title: Reasonable value, but silly payment policy
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Rho @ the end of May. It had been recommended by a friend.The hotel was clean,our room was fairly small, no view at all, a roof and another roof!! The bathroom sink leaked and the showerhead just flopped to one side.The room was quiet considering it was backing onto the lift.The breakfast was good and plentiful.A fairly average hotel, excellent location.One thing did however bother us,on our final night about half one in the morning,a man came into our room!He had obviously got the wrong room but his plastic key fob had given him access into our room! We informed the staff the next morning who said they would check and change the code.I personally wouldn't go back and stay at the Hotel Rho.

reviews.title: Interesting
reviews.text: We stayed at the RHO hotel for 3 days in May 2006 and overall was happy with the hotel.

reviews.title: BEWARE...wouldn't stay there again!
reviews.text: We stayed on the top (4th) floor in room 440. The room itself was large and clean, with a reasonably large sized bathroom. Being the top floor, the corridor had a Dutch style sloping roof, but the room did not. The room looked inward into a courtyard (of sorts), so there was little external noise, but also little ventilation. This resulted in having to keep the window wide open 24 hours just to get some cool air – this would be a big problem in the hot summer – so maybe ask for a street view room

reviews.title: Great location!
reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Rho for a weekend break with 5 friends. Girls weekend (though all 40 something. Ideal location to see all the sights of Amsterdam, easy to know where the horel is as it's next to the big yellow clog shop on Dam Square.I had read some Rho hotel reviews on this web site and it wasn't as bad as some people make out.

reviews.title: Appalling
reviews.text: Plenty of hot water, though no bath in my room. Breakfast was fine with plenty to choose from and yes it was the same each day but there was enough choice to vary your own menu.Tea & coffee facilities would be next in the room, though I'm told by the senior desk staff that isn't classed as 3* in Holland ( I was in Madrid last week ans stayed in a superior 3* to the Rho & no T or C facilities in the room there either.)

reviews.title: Great value budget hotel
reviews.text: Yes it is a bit noisy and quite alot of singles and younger groups staying there, but all in all it was value for money and ideal for visting such a strange city as Amsterdam.Not the hotel I would choose for a romantic w/end away with my husband but definately suitable for a w/end visit with friends.

reviews.title: Pity about the staff
reviews.text: The worst "Hotel" I have ever stayed in. I would not recommend it to my Dog.

reviews.title: Very good
reviews.text: Stopped here in Jan/Feb 2006 mainly due to its location which is excellent, the breakfast is spot on, the staff nice and polite (the guy that cleans the rooms was cool with me leaving a baggie or two on the table!) the only thing that let it down for me was the thin walls but luckily our neighbours weren't too noisy!
